title: Boot and Login Flow
description: Verify that the user can boot into the PortfolioOS using the simulated login screen with any input or guest access and reach the desktop environment.

steps.description: Navigate to PortfolioOS boot screen
Enter valid login input or select guest access
Submit login form
Check that desktop environment is loaded with icons and taskbar visible

title: Desktop Icon Interactions
description: Test the ability to interact with desktop icons including dragging and opening corresponding applications.

steps.description: Locate a desktop icon
Drag the icon to a new position and release
Verify icon position is updated and persisted
Double-click the icon to open the associated application
Confirm that the correct application window opens and gains focus

title: Window Management - Drag, Resize, Minimize, Maximize, Snap
description: Ensure all window management functionalities work as expected, including dragging windows, resizing, minimizing, maximizing, snapping to screen edges, and keyboard shortcuts.

steps.description: Open any application window
Drag window to new location
Window position is updated correctly
Resize window using mouse by dragging edges and corners
Window resizes smoothly without visual glitches
Click minimize button
Window minimizes to taskbar or dock
Click maximize button
Window maximizes to full desktop area
Drag window to edge to trigger snap
Window snaps properly to screen edge
Use keyboard shortcuts to minimize, maximize, and close a window
Keyboard shortcut functions perform expected window management actions

title: Theme and Wallpaper Customization Persistence
description: Verify theme and wallpaper selections apply instantly and persist correctly across sessions using localStorage.

steps.description: Open Settings application
Change theme to dark, light, and system modes
UI theme updates accordingly with smooth transition
Select different wallpaper images
Desktop wallpaper updates immediately
Reload the browser or re-open PortfolioOS
Selected theme and wallpaper persist and are correctly loaded

title: Contact Form Validation and Submission
description: Verify client-side validation using Zod is enforced, server-side email sending via Resend works, and user receives proper feedback via toast notifications.

steps.description: Open Contact application
Submit empty form
Validation errors shown for required fields
Fill inputs with invalid email and submit
Validation error for invalid email format is shown
Fill valid data and submit form
Form submits successfully
Success toast notification is displayed
Simulate server error response on submission
Error toast notification is displayed indicating submission failure

title: Accessibility Compliance Check
description: Ensure all UI components across the OS comply with accessibility standards including ARIA roles, labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support.

steps.description: Use keyboard to navigate entire OS interface starting from login to desktop apps
All interactive elements are reachable and operable using keyboard only
Use screen reader to traverse UI
All UI components provide meaningful ARIA attributes and screen reader announces them correctly
Verify focus management on opening/closing windows and dialogs
Focus is correctly set and trapped where appropriate

title: Notification Center Functionality and Accessibility
description: Test notification center for keyboard and pointer interactions, proper focus management, and screen reader alerts.

steps.description: Trigger a system notification
Notification appears in notification center
Use keyboard to open notification center
Notification center opens and receives focus
Navigate through notifications using keyboard
Focus moves correctly across each notification item
Use pointer to click a notification
Notification interaction responds correctly and dismisses if applicable
Verify screen reader announces new notifications
Screen reader reads notification content and alert role is properly set

title: Responsive Design across Devices
description: Verify that the UI adapts gracefully across desktop, tablet, and mobile environments, including touch gesture support and appropriate layout changes.

steps.description: Open PortfolioOS on desktop viewport
Full OS interface with desktop icons, taskbar, and resizable windows is visible
Resize viewport to tablet dimensions
Layout adjusts to tablet view with appropriate scaling and touch-friendly controls
Open PortfolioOS on mobile viewport
Mobile-optimized UI with bottom navigation for minimized windows is visible
Use touch gestures to open, close, minimize, and navigate windows
Touch gestures respond accurately and UI behaves as expected

title: Error Boundary Handling
description: Validate that the error boundary component catches runtime errors in any part of the app and displays fallback UI without crashing the whole application.

steps.description: Introduce a runtime error in a component (simulate throwing an error)
Error boundary catches the error and renders fallback UI
Other parts of the OS remain operational and user can continue interacting

title: Performance and Animation Smoothness
description: Ensure performance optimizations such as lazy loading and smooth animations are functioning under typical user interactions.

steps.description: Open multiple applications with delayed load components
Lazy loading triggers as expected and no blocking UI occurs
Perform window drag, resize, theme switch, and open animations
Animations are smooth with no jank or frame drops

title: System-Wide Search Functionality
description: Test the system search application can find and open installed applications and portfolio content reliably.

steps.description: Focus on the system search input
Type partial application names or portfolio content keywords
Relevant search results appear dynamically
Select a result via keyboard or pointer
The corresponding app or content window opens and gains focus

title: Contact Form Server Failure Fallback Handling
description: Confirm that when the Resend API fails or is unreachable, the system simulates sending with proper user notification and does not crash.

steps.description: Intercept contact form submission and simulate Resend API failure
Submit form with valid inputs
Fallback simulation triggers and success notification is shown
Application remains stable with no crashes or unresponsive UI

title: Local Storage Persistence for Window Positions and Icon Layout
description: Verify window positions, sizes, and desktop icon layouts persist accurately across sessions using localStorage.

steps.description: Move and resize an open application window
Rearrange multiple desktop icons
Reload the application
Previously set window sizes and positions are restored
Desktop icons are shown in the rearranged positions

title: Keyboard Shortcut for Window Management
description: Test all supported keyboard shortcuts related to window management are recognized and perform correct actions.

steps.description: Open an application window and bring it into focus
Use keyboard shortcuts for minimize, maximize, snap, and close
Each shortcut triggers the correct window management operation
No unexpected side effects occur and focus is managed properly

title: Glassmorphism UI Theme Modes and Transitions
description: Verify the glassmorphism-based UI design supports light, dark, and system theme modes with smooth visual effects and animations.

steps.description: Switch between light, dark, and system theme modes in settings
Glassmorphism effects render correctly in all modes
Transitions between themes are smooth with proper animations
